Indian.title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes
1/2 cup raw cashews, soaked and ground
Indian.instructions: Marinate chicken breast cubes in yogurt and tandoori masala for 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan and sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until golden brown. Add tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes until oil separates. Add tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes until sauce thickens. Add marinated chicken breast and cook for 8-10 minutes until chicken is fully cooked through. Add heavy cream and ground cashews, simmering for 5 minutes until sauce thickens. Stir in butter and fenugreek leaves. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread and basmati rice.

Indian.title: Biryani
ingredients: 1.5 lbs bone-in chicken thighs, cut into pieces
Indian.instructions: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Marinate chicken thighs in yogurt and biryani masala for 1 hour. Heat ghee in a large pot and add whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf). Add sliced onions and cook until golden. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cook for 2 minutes. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10 minutes until partially done. Layer half the soaked rice over chicken. Sprinkle mint, cilantro, fried onions, cashews, and raisins. Layer remaining rice. Soak saffron in warm milk and drizzle over rice. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Indian.title: Palak Paneer
Indian.instructions: Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then blend to smooth paste. Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Add chopped onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach paste and cook for 5 minutes. Add cream, salt, and sugar. Gently add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes. Add lemon juice and garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Indian.title: Rogan Josh
ingredients: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, cut into 2-inch pieces
Indian.instructions: Heat ghee in a large pot and add whole spices. Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 2 minutes. Add lamb pieces and brown on all sides. Add yogurt, chili powder, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes. Add water, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

Indian.title: Masala Dosa
ingredients: For filling: 4 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.instructions: Soak rice and dals separately for 6 hours. Grind to smooth batter and ferment overnight. For filling, heat oil and add mustard and cumin seeds. Add onions and green chilies, cook until soft. Add spices and mashed potatoes. Mix well and set aside. Heat a griddle and pour batter to make thin crepes. Cook until golden, add filling, and fold. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Indian.title: Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: Fresh cilantro and lemon wedges for garnish
Indian.instructions: Make deep cuts in chicken pieces. Mix yogurt with all spices, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, and salt. Marinate chicken for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 400°F. Place chicken on a rack and bake for 25-30 minutes, turning once. Brush with oil and broil for 5 minutes until charred. Garnish with cilantro and serve with lemon wedges.

Indian.title: Dal Makhani
Indian.instructions: Soak dals overnight and pressure cook until soft. Heat butter and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cooked dals and simmer for 30 minutes. Add cream and cook for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

Indian.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
Indian.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and tandoori masala for 1 hour. Heat butter and cook onions until golden. Add garlic and ginger. Add tomato puree and spices. Add marinated chicken and cook for 15 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

Indian.title: Aloo Gobi
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add cauliflower and cook for 10-15 minutes until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Indian.title: Gulab Jamun
Indian.instructions: Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda. Add ghee and enough milk to make soft dough. Make small balls and deep fry until golden brown. For syrup, boil sugar and water with cardamom. Add rose water and saffron. Soak fried balls in warm syrup for 30 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Indian.title: Chole Bhature
Indian.instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas until soft. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 20 minutes. For bhature, mix flour with yogurt, salt, and sugar. Knead into soft dough and rest for 2 hours. Roll into circles and deep fry until puffed. Serve hot with chole.

Indian.title: Rajma Masala
Indian.instructions: Pressure cook kidney beans until soft. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cooked beans and simmer for 30 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.

Indian.title: Fish Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add mustard and cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add fish pieces and cook for 10-15 minutes until done. Add curry leaves and garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice.

Indian.title: Samosa
ingredients: For filling: 3 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.instructions: Make dough with flour, oil, and salt. For filling, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and chilies. Add spices and mashed potatoes with peas. Mix well and cool. Roll dough into circles, add filling, and seal into triangles. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

Indian.title: Rasgulla
Indian.instructions: Boil milk and add lemon juice to curdle. Strain through muslin cloth and rinse. Knead the paneer until smooth. Make small balls and set aside. Boil sugar and water with cardamom. Add paneer balls and cook for 15 minutes. Add rose water and cool. Serve chilled.

Indian.title: Kadai Paneer
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add tomato puree and spices. Add bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add paneer cubes and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Indian.title: Mutton Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add mutton and brown on all sides. Add tomato puree and spices. Cover and cook for 1.5 hours until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

Indian.title: Malai Kofta
ingredients: For koftas: 3 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.instructions: Mix mashed potatoes with paneer, cornflour, and spices. Make balls and deep fry until golden. For gravy, heat oil and cook onions until golden. Add garlic and ginger. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cream and simmer. Add koftas and cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Indian.title: Chicken Biryani
Indian.instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 1 hour. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic and ginger. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10 minutes. Layer half the rice over chicken. Add fried onions, cashews, and raisins. Layer remaining rice. Soak saffron in milk and drizzle over rice. Cover and cook on low heat for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Indian.title: Aloo Paratha
ingredients: For filling: 3 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.instructions: Make dough with flour and salt. For filling, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and chilies. Add spices and mashed potatoes. Mix well and cool. Roll dough into circles, add filling, and seal. Roll again into paratha. Cook on griddle with ghee until golden on both sides. Serve hot with yogurt and pickle.

Indian.title: Kheer
Indian.instructions: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add rice and cook on low heat for 30 minutes, stirring frequently. Add sugar and cook for 10 minutes. Add nuts, raisins, and cardamom powder. Add rose water and saffron. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Indian.title: Quick Dal Tadka
Indian.instructions: Cook lentils in water with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes. Heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Add onion and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes. Cook for 3 minutes. Add cooked dal and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Aloo Gobi
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes. Cook for 2 minutes. Add potatoes and cauliflower. Add turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Chicken Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes. Cook for 3 minutes. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add spices and salt. Simmer for 8 minutes until chicken is cooked. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Jeera Rice
Indian.instructions: Wash and soak rice for 10 minutes. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add water and salt. Bring to boil, then simmer for 15 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork and garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Raita
Indian.instructions: Whisk yogurt until smooth. Squeeze excess water from cucumber. Mix cucumber, onion, cumin powder, chaat masala, and salt with yogurt. Chill for 10 minutes. Garnish with mint leaves before serving.

Indian.title: Quick Chana Masala
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes. Cook for 3 minutes. Add chickpeas and spices. Simmer for 8 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Vegetable Biryani
Indian.instructions: Cook rice until 70% done. Heat ghee and cook onion until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and vegetables. Cook for 3 minutes. Add spices and salt. Layer rice over vegetables. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Samosa
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and cook until golden. Add ginger, potatoes, peas, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 3 minutes. Fill wrappers with mixture and seal. Deep fry until golden. Serve hot with chutney.

Indian.title: Quick Lassi
Indian.instructions: Blend yogurt, milk, sugar, and cardamom powder until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again. Pour into glasses and garnish with mint leaves. Serve chilled.

Indian.title: Quick Paneer Tikka
Indian.instructions: Mix yogurt with spices and salt. Marinate paneer and vegetables for 10 minutes. Heat oil in pan and cook paneer and vegetables for 5 minutes until golden. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Indian.title: Instant Dal Tadka
Indian.instructions: Boil lentils in water for 8 minutes until soft. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and spices, cook for 3 minutes. Add cooked dal and simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Aloo Gobi
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes. Add potatoes and cauliflower, cook for 8 minutes. Add spices and salt, cook for 3 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Speedy Chicken Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, cook for 3 minutes. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 7 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Jeera Rice
Indian.instructions: Heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Add cooked rice and salt, mix gently for 3 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Indian.title: Instant Raita
Indian.instructions: Mix yogurt with grated cucumber, cumin powder, and salt. Garnish with mint leaves and red chili powder. Serve chilled.

Indian.title: Quick Chana Masala
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add chickpeas and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Speedy Egg Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 5 minutes. Add halved eggs and cook for 3 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Vegetable Pulao
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and vegetables, cook for 3 minutes. Add water, spices, and salt. Cook for 12 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Instant Sambar
Indian.instructions: Boil dal and vegetables in water for 10 minutes. Heat oil and add mustard seeds. Add sambar powder and turmeric, cook for 1 minute. Add to dal mixture and simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Fish Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add fish and cook for 8 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Speedy Rajma Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add kidney beans and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Matar Paneer
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add paneer and peas, cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Instant Upma
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add mustard seeds. Add onion and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes. Add semolina and cook for 3 minutes. Add water, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Baingan Bharta
Indian.instructions: Mash roasted eggplant. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add mashed eggplant and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Speedy Mutton Curry
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, cook for 3 minutes. Add mutton and cook for 8 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Dal Makhani
Indian.instructions: Boil lentils and beans in water for 15 minutes. Heat butter and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 4 minutes. Add cooked dal and simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Instant Vegetable Biryani
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Add rice and vegetables, cook for 3 minutes. Add water, spices, and salt. Cook for 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Quick Chicken Tikka Masala
Indian.instructions: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 7 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 3 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

Indian.title: Speedy Aloo Paratha
Indian.instructions: Make dough with flour and water. Mix mashed potatoes with onion, green chilies, and spices. Roll dough, add filling, and seal. Cook on griddle with oil for 4 minutes per side. Serve hot.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Heat 1 tbsp ghee in pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes. Add all greens and 1 cup water. Pressure cook for 3 whistles. Let cool, then blend to smooth paste. Heat remaining ghee in kadai, add tomato puree and spices. Cook for 3 minutes until oil separates. Add blended greens and cornmeal. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring constantly. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with makki ki roti.
Indian.chef_tips: For authentic flavor, use fresh mustard greens and bathua. The cornmeal adds thickness and authentic texture. Cook on low heat to prevent burning. Serve immediately for best taste and texture.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds until fragrant. Grind to fine powder. Heat ghee in heavy pot and add whole spices. Add sliced onions and cook until deep golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 2 minutes. Add lamb pieces and brown on all sides for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, ground spices, chili powder, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes until oil separates. Add water, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro and saffron. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Use authentic Kashmiri red chili powder for the signature color. Slow cooking is essential for tender meat. The dish should have a rich, oily consistency. Soak saffron in warm milk before garnishing for better color dispersion.

ingredients: For Baati: 2 cups whole wheat flour
For Dal: 1/2 cup split pigeon peas (toor dal)
Indian.cooking_instructions: For Baati: Mix flour, semolina, ghee, and salt. Add water to make stiff dough. Shape into small balls. Bake at 400°F for 25-30 minutes until golden. For Dal: Pressure cook all dals with turmeric and salt. Heat ghee, add cumin seeds, onions, garlic, and ginger. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cooked dal and simmer for 15 minutes. For Churma: Crumble baked baatis and mix with jaggery, ghee, and nuts. Serve hot baatis with dal and churma.
Indian.chef_tips: Baatis should be hard and dry. Traditionally cooked in tandoor. The dal should be thick and flavorful. Churma adds sweetness to balance the spicy dal. Serve immediately for authentic experience.

ingredients: 2 large onions, sliced and fried until golden
Indian.cooking_instructions: Grind fried onions to paste. Dry roast whole spices and grind to powder. Mix minced lamb with papaya paste, onion paste, garlic, ginger, and all spices. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth. Heat ghee on tawa. Shape mixture into thin patties. Cook on low heat for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with roomali roti and mint chutney.
Indian.chef_tips: The papaya paste tenderizes the meat. Kneading is crucial for smooth texture. Cook on low heat to prevent burning. These kebabs should melt in the mouth. Use fresh spices for best flavor.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Fry sliced onions until golden brown and grind to paste. Grind soaked cashews to smooth paste. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, onion paste, and cashew paste. Add all spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.
Indian.chef_tips: The onion paste gives the dish its signature sweetness. Cashews add richness and creaminess. Cook on low heat to prevent curdling. The dish should have a smooth, velvety texture.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Mix flour, semolina, ghee, and salt. Add water to make soft dough. Knead for 10 minutes. For filling, mix walnuts, raisins, jaggery, and spices with ghee. Divide dough into small balls. Roll each ball, add filling, and seal. Shape into oval buns. Steam for 20-25 minutes until cooked through. Serve hot with ghee and pickle.
Indian.chef_tips: The dough should be soft but not sticky. Steaming time depends on size. Traditional Himachali bread with sweet filling. Serve immediately for best texture.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Heat mustard oil in kadai and add cumin and coriander seeds. Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Add turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala. Add cubed potatoes and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti or rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Mustard oil gives authentic Kumaoni flavor. Don't overcook potatoes to maintain texture. Traditional mountain cuisine from Uttarakhand.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Pressure cook kidney beans with turmeric and salt for 3 whistles. Heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked rajma and simmer for 15 minutes. For rice, cook basmati rice separately. Serve hot rajma over rice with cilantro garnish.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Dogri comfort food from Jammu region. The rajma should be thick and flavorful. Perfect combination with aromatic basmati rice.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas with turmeric and salt for 3 whistles. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 20 minutes. For bhature, mix flour with yogurt, salt, and sugar. Knead into soft dough and rest for 2 hours. Roll into circles and deep fry until puffed. Serve hot chole with bhature.
Indian.chef_tips: Classic Punjabi street food. Bhature should be soft and puffy. The chole should be thick and spicy. Perfect for breakfast or brunch.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and lamb. Brown lamb on all sides. Add yogurt and ground spices. Cook for 10 minutes. Add milk and simmer for 45 minutes until lamb is tender. Season with salt. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri yogurt-based curry. The dish should be mild and aromatic. Don't let the yogurt curdle. Slow cooking is essential.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Mix cornmeal with salt and warm water. Add ghee and knead into soft dough. Divide into small balls. Place each ball on plastic sheet and pat into thin roti using hands. Heat tawa and cook roti on medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side. Apply ghee while cooking. Serve hot with sarson da saag.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional winter bread from Punjab. Use warm water for better binding. Pat with hands instead of rolling pin. Cook on medium heat to prevent burning.

Indian.cooking_instructions: For Gatte: Mix besan with yogurt, spices, and oil. Knead into stiff dough. Shape into cylindrical rolls. Boil in water for 10 minutes. Cool and cut into pieces. For Curry: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add gatte pieces and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani dish. The gatte should be firm but not hard. Don't overcook in boiling water. Perfect for dry regions with limited vegetables.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and yogurt. Add ground spices, chili powder, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and cream. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri dum cooking method. The potatoes should be tender and flavorful. Don't stir too much to maintain potato shape. Slow cooking is key.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast cumin, coriander, and fennel seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and beef. Brown beef on all sides. Add yogurt and ground spices. Cook for 10 minutes. Add water and simmer for 1.5 hours until beef is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro and ginger julienne. Serve hot with naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi slow-cooked stew. The meat should be falling off the bone. Long cooking time is essential. Perfect for special occasions.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Marinate mutton in yogurt and spices for 1 hour. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and marinated mutton. Cook for 10 minutes. Layer half the rice over mutton. Add fried onions, cashews, and raisins. Layer remaining rice. Soak saffron in warm milk and drizzle over rice. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai biryani with mutton. The rice should be perfectly cooked and aromatic. Don't stir after layering. Let it rest before serving.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas and kidney beans with turmeric and salt for 3 whistles. Heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and yogurt. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked beans and simmer for 15 minutes. Add cream and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Himachali yogurt-based curry. The dish should be creamy and mild. Don't let the yogurt curdle. Perfect for cold mountain regions.

ingredients: For filling: 2 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.cooking_instructions: Mix flour with yogurt, salt, sugar, ghee, baking powder, and baking soda. Add water to make soft dough. Knead for 10 minutes. For filling, mix mashed potatoes with paneer, spices, and cilantro. Divide dough into balls. Roll each ball, add filling, and seal. Roll again into thick circles. Cook on tawa for 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Serve hot with chole and pickle.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Amritsari kulcha from Punjab. The dough should be soft and fluffy. Don't overstuff the filling. Cook on medium heat for even browning.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak ker and sangri overnight. Drain and rinse. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add ker and sangri. Simmer for 30 minutes until tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani desert delicacy. The berries and beans need long soaking. Cook slowly to develop flavors. Perfect for arid regions with limited fresh vegetables.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Knead minced mutton with salt for 10 minutes until smooth. Shape into large balls. Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add garlic, ginger, and yogurt. Add ground spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add mutton balls and cook for 10 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 45 minutes until tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri royal dish. The mutton balls should be large and tender. Kneading is crucial for smooth texture. Slow cooking is essential.

ingredients: 2 large onions, sliced and fried until golden
Indian.cooking_instructions: Grind fried onions to paste. Dry roast whole spices and grind to powder. Mix minced lamb with papaya paste, onion paste, garlic, ginger, and all spices. Knead for 15 minutes until very smooth. Shape into long cylindrical kebabs. Heat ghee on tawa. Cook kebabs on low heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with roomali roti and mint chutney.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi delicacy. The kebabs should be very smooth and melt in the mouth. Extensive kneading is essential. Cook on very low heat.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Cut bread slices into triangles. Heat ghee and deep fry bread until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Make sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until one-string consistency. Mix cream with milk, cardamom powder, and saffron. Dip fried bread in sugar syrup. Arrange on serving plate. Pour cream mixture over bread. Garnish with nuts, raisins, and rose water. Serve chilled.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai royal dessert. The bread should be crispy but not burnt. The sugar syrup should be thick. Chill before serving for best taste.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Blend yogurt, water, sugar, and cardamom powder until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again. Pour into serving glasses. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve chilled immediately.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Punjabi cooling drink. Use chilled yogurt for best taste. Don't over-blend to maintain texture. Perfect for hot summer days.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Heat ghee and add sliced onions. Cook until deep golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and mutton. Brown mutton on all sides. Add turmeric, coriander, and cumin powder. Cook for 5 minutes. Add Mathania red chili powder and cook for 10 minutes. Add water and simmer for 1 hour until mutton is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani fiery curry. Mathania red chili powder is essential for authentic flavor. The dish should be very spicy and red in color. Slow cooking is crucial.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Soak saffron in warm milk. Heat ghee and add cashews, almonds, and raisins. Cook until golden. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and salt. Add water and cook for 15 minutes. Add saffron milk and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with rose water. Serve hot.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri sweet pulao. The rice should be slightly sweet and aromatic. Don't overcook the rice. Perfect for special occasions.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Fry sliced onions until golden brown and grind to paste. Grind soaked cashews to smooth paste. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add mutton and cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, onion paste, and cashew paste. Add all spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 45 minutes until mutton is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi royal curry. The onion paste gives sweetness. Cashews add richness. Slow cooking is essential for tender meat.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 1 hour. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and marinated chicken. Cook for 10 minutes. Layer half the rice over chicken. Add fried onions, cashews, and raisins. Layer remaining rice. Soak saffron in warm milk and drizzle over rice. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai biryani. The rice should be perfectly cooked and aromatic. Don't stir after layering. Let it rest before serving.

Indian.recipe_name: Punjabi Sarson da Saag with Makki ki Roti
Indian.cooking_instructions: Heat 1 tbsp ghee in pressure cooker and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes. Add all greens and 1 cup water. Pressure cook for 3 whistles. Let cool, then blend to smooth paste. Heat remaining ghee in kadai, add tomato puree and spices. Cook for 3 minutes until oil separates. Add blended greens and cornmeal. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring constantly. For roti, mix cornmeal with salt and warm water. Add ghee and knead into soft dough. Shape into balls and pat into thin rotis. Cook on tawa for 2-3 minutes per side. Serve hot saag with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Punjabi winter delicacy. The saag should be thick and flavorful. The roti should be soft and pliable. Perfect combination for cold weather.

ingredients: For Baati: 2 cups whole wheat flour
For Dal: 1/2 cup split pigeon peas (toor dal)
Indian.cooking_instructions: For Baati: Mix flour, semolina, ghee, and salt. Add water to make stiff dough. Shape into small balls. Bake at 400°F for 25-30 minutes until golden. For Dal: Pressure cook all dals with turmeric and salt. Heat ghee, add cumin seeds, onions, garlic, and ginger. Add tomato puree and spices. Add cooked dal and simmer for 15 minutes. For Churma: Crumble baked baatis and mix with jaggery, ghee, and nuts. Serve hot baatis with dal and churma.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani complete meal. Baatis should be hard and dry. The dal should be thick and flavorful. Churma adds sweetness to balance the spicy dal.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds until fragrant. Grind to fine powder. Heat ghee in heavy pot and add whole spices. Add sliced onions and cook until deep golden brown. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 2 minutes. Add lamb pieces and brown on all sides for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, ground spices, chili powder, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes until oil separates. Add water, cover, and simmer for 1.5 hours until lamb is tender. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro and saffron. Serve hot with steamed rice or naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri signature dish. Use authentic Kashmiri red chili powder for the signature color. Slow cooking is essential for tender meat. The dish should have a rich, oily consistency.

ingredients: 2 large onions, sliced and fried until golden
Indian.cooking_instructions: Grind fried onions to paste. Dry roast whole spices and grind to powder. Mix minced lamb with papaya paste, onion paste, garlic, ginger, and all spices. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth. Heat ghee on tawa. Shape mixture into thin patties. Cook on low heat for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with roomali roti and mint chutney.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi royal delicacy. The papaya paste tenderizes the meat. Kneading is crucial for smooth texture. These kebabs should melt in the mouth. Use fresh spices for best flavor.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Fry sliced onions until golden brown and grind to paste. Grind soaked cashews to smooth paste. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt, onion paste, and cashew paste. Add all spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai royal curry. The onion paste gives the dish its signature sweetness. Cashews add richness and creaminess. Cook on low heat to prevent curdling.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas with turmeric and salt for 3 whistles. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 20 minutes. For bhature, mix flour with yogurt, salt, and sugar. Knead into soft dough and rest for 2 hours. Roll into circles and deep fry until puffed. Serve hot chole with bhature.
Indian.chef_tips: Classic Punjabi street food. Bhature should be soft and puffy. The chole should be thick and spicy. Perfect for breakfast or brunch.

Indian.cooking_instructions: For Gatte: Mix besan with yogurt, spices, and oil. Knead into stiff dough. Shape into cylindrical rolls. Boil in water for 10 minutes. Cool and cut into pieces. For Curry: Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add gatte pieces and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani dish. The gatte should be firm but not hard. Don't overcook in boiling water. Perfect for dry regions with limited vegetables.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and yogurt. Add ground spices, chili powder, and turmeric. Cook for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and cream. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri dum cooking method. The potatoes should be tender and flavorful. Don't stir too much to maintain potato shape. Slow cooking is key.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Dry roast cumin, coriander, and fennel seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and beef. Brown beef on all sides. Add yogurt and ground spices. Cook for 10 minutes. Add water and simmer for 1.5 hours until beef is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro and ginger julienne. Serve hot with naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi slow-cooked stew. The meat should be falling off the bone. Long cooking time is essential. Perfect for special occasions.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Marinate mutton in yogurt and spices for 1 hour. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and marinated mutton. Cook for 10 minutes. Layer half the rice over mutton. Add fried onions, cashews, and raisins. Layer remaining rice. Soak saffron in warm milk and drizzle over rice. Cover tightly and cook on low heat for 25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai biryani with mutton. The rice should be perfectly cooked and aromatic. Don't stir after layering. Let it rest before serving.

ingredients: For filling: 2 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
Indian.cooking_instructions: Mix flour with yogurt, salt, sugar, ghee, baking powder, and baking soda. Add water to make soft dough. Knead for 10 minutes. For filling, mix mashed potatoes with paneer, spices, and cilantro. Divide dough into balls. Roll each ball, add filling, and seal. Roll again into thick circles. Cook on tawa for 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Serve hot with chole and pickle.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Amritsari kulcha from Punjab. The dough should be soft and fluffy. Don't overstuff the filling. Cook on medium heat for even browning.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak ker and sangri overnight. Drain and rinse. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Add onions and cook until golden. Add garlic, ginger, and tomato puree. Add spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add ker and sangri. Simmer for 30 minutes until tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani desert delicacy. The berries and beans need long soaking. Cook slowly to develop flavors. Perfect for arid regions with limited fresh vegetables.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Knead minced mutton with salt for 10 minutes until smooth. Shape into large balls. Dry roast fennel, cumin, and coriander seeds. Grind to powder. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add garlic, ginger, and yogurt. Add ground spices and cook for 5 minutes. Add mutton balls and cook for 10 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 45 minutes until tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with rice.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri royal dish. The mutton balls should be large and tender. Kneading is crucial for smooth texture. Slow cooking is essential.

ingredients: 2 large onions, sliced and fried until golden
Indian.cooking_instructions: Grind fried onions to paste. Dry roast whole spices and grind to powder. Mix minced lamb with papaya paste, onion paste, garlic, ginger, and all spices. Knead for 15 minutes until very smooth. Shape into long cylindrical kebabs. Heat ghee on tawa. Cook kebabs on low heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve hot with roomali roti and mint chutney.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi delicacy. The kebabs should be very smooth and melt in the mouth. Extensive kneading is essential. Cook on very low heat.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Cut bread slices into triangles. Heat ghee and deep fry bread until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Make sugar syrup by boiling sugar and water until one-string consistency. Mix cream with milk, cardamom powder, and saffron. Dip fried bread in sugar syrup. Arrange on serving plate. Pour cream mixture over bread. Garnish with nuts, raisins, and rose water. Serve chilled.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Mughlai royal dessert. The bread should be crispy but not burnt. The sugar syrup should be thick. Chill before serving for best taste.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Blend yogurt, water, sugar, and cardamom powder until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again. Pour into serving glasses. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve chilled immediately.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Punjabi cooling drink. Use chilled yogurt for best taste. Don't over-blend to maintain texture. Perfect for hot summer days.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Heat ghee and add sliced onions. Cook until deep golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and mutton. Brown mutton on all sides. Add turmeric, coriander, and cumin powder. Cook for 5 minutes. Add Mathania red chili powder and cook for 10 minutes. Add water and simmer for 1 hour until mutton is tender. Season with salt and garam masala. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with roti.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Rajasthani fiery curry. Mathania red chili powder is essential for authentic flavor. The dish should be very spicy and red in color. Slow cooking is crucial.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Soak saffron in warm milk. Heat ghee and add cashews, almonds, and raisins. Cook until golden. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and salt. Add water and cook for 15 minutes. Add saffron milk and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with rose water. Serve hot.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Kashmiri sweet pulao. The rice should be slightly sweet and aromatic. Don't overcook the rice. Perfect for special occasions.

Indian.cooking_instructions: Fry sliced onions until golden brown and grind to paste. Grind soaked cashews to smooth paste. Heat ghee and add whole spices. Add mutton and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan.
Indian.chef_tips: Traditional Awadhi royal curry. The onion paste gives sweetness. Cashews add richness. Slow cooking is essential for tender meat.
